Operation 'SendTestMarketingEmail' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The original summary 'Send a Test Marketing Email' is generic and doesn't convey the key differentiator (up to 10 recipients for testing). The description, while comprehensive, buries critical requirements and lacks clarity on response behavior and side effects. The improved summary is more specific and action-oriented. The improved description reorganizes information for better AI agent interpretability by: (1) leading with the core purpose and use case, (2) clearly listing required inputs with constraints, (3) explicitly stating the response code and its meaning, (4) highlighting the template type restriction, and (5) clarifying that test emails don't affect production contact lists. This helps AI agents understand when to invoke this operation and what to expect.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to send a test marketing email to a list of email addresses**.

Before sending a marketing message, you can test it using this endpoint. You may specify up to **10 contacts** in the `emails` request body field. You must also specify a `template_id` and include either a `from_address` or `sender_id`. You can manage your templates with the [Twilio SendGrid App](https://mc.sendgrid.com/dynamic-templates) or the [Transactional Templates API](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/transactional-templates).

> Please note that this endpoint works with Dynamic Transactional Templates only. Legacy Transactional Templates will not be delivered.

For more information about managing Dynamic Transactional Templates, see [How to Send Email with Dynamic Transactional Templates](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/how-to-send-an-email-with-dynamic-transactional-templates/).

You can also test your Single Sends in the [Twilio SendGrid Marketing Campaigns UI](https://mc.sendgrid.com/single-sends).
data.summary_suggestion: Send test marketing email to up to 10 recipients
data.description_suggestion:
Sends a test marketing email to a list of up to 10 email addresses before deploying to a contact list or segment. This allows you to validate email layout, content, and rendering across multiple email clients and recipients.

**Required inputs:**
- `emails`: Array of up to 10 recipient email addresses
- `template_id`: ID of a Dynamic Transactional Template (Legacy templates are not supported)
- Either `from_address` or `sender_id`: Sender identification

**Response:** Returns HTTP 202 Accepted, indicating the test email has been queued for delivery.

**Important:** This endpoint only works with Dynamic Transactional Templates. Test emails are sent immediately to the specified recipients and do not affect your contact lists or segments.
data.reasoning: The original summary 'Send a Test Marketing Email' is generic and doesn't convey the key differentiator (up to 10 recipients for testing). The description, while comprehensive, buries critical requirements and lacks clarity on response behavior and side effects. The improved summary is more specific and action-oriented. The improved description reorganizes information for better AI agent interpretability by: (1) leading with the core purpose and use case, (2) clearly listing required inputs with constraints, (3) explicitly stating the response code and its meaning, (4) highlighting the template type restriction, and (5) clarifying that test emails don't affect production contact lists. This helps AI agents understand when to invoke this operation and what to expect.
